```{r, message = FALSE}
# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)
source("helper.R")
```

```{r}
# Read in raw data from the Rev survey. These are the files downloaded from survey monkey saved as a .csv
raw_data_rev <- read.csv("data/rev_text.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# Pull out all responses for Q62 (a single selection question) combine, then determine 'question n'

Q62 <- "What.US.state.do.you.live.in."

Q62_rev <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_rev, q.name = Q62)

Q62_all <- rbind(Q62_rev)

number_of_people <- length(unique(Q62_all$id))
```

```{r}
# Manipulate data into a graphable format
Q62_plot <- 
  Q62_all %>%
  group_by(response) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent_all = count / sum(count)) %>%
  mutate(percent_responded = count / number_of_people)
```

```{r}
# Plot with percents and response counts
r <- 
  ggplot(Q62_plot, aes(x = reorder(response, count), y = percent_responded)) +
  geom_bar(stat = 'identity') +
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(aes(label= paste(round(percent_responded, 2), count, sep = "***")))

r
```

```{r}
# Save graph as PNG, plot data as csv, and all question data including response IDs as csv (save question n and N at end of plot file as "_x.x")
ggsave(filename = 'rev_q62_state.png', plot = r, device = 'png')

write.csv(Q62_plot, 'rev_q62_state_103.305.csv', row.names = FALSE)

write.csv(Q62_all, 'rev_q62_state_ids.csv', row.names = FALSE)
```
